availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Office of H. M. & H. G. Parker,
Counsellors at Law,
46 Washington Street
Henry M. Parker.
Horatio G. Parker.
Boston March 20th 1863.
Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
Suffolk ss. March 20th 1863.

Having been commissioned by His Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on the sixth day of March A. D. 1863 a Commissioner to take acknowledgments of deeds within the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, to be recorded in said Commonwealth of Kentucky and for other purposes as provided in said commission by the laws of Kentucky, I do solemnly swear that I, Henry M. Parker, Commissioner as aforesaid will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said station to which I have been commissioned as aforesaid
Commonwealth of Massachusetts } Suffolk Ss. Mch 20th 1863.

Sworn to this day before me.
Chas W. Lovett
Jus. peace

Massachussetts
Oath of H. M. Parker
Comr of Deeds
Filed Apr 2. 1863
